Author: ardit33
Content:
Actually the LG Prada was out in Europe before, and it is touch screen device, similiar screen size, and with a pretty UI.\nNot as nice as the iPhone, but 80% close. What iPhone made, is people demanding pretty UIs from all their phones, which is a step on the right direction. Still, there are plenty of things that you cannot do with the iPhone.

But as far as businnsess paradigm shift, iPhone has been a disapointment. Look at the latest update, it bricks your unlocked device, cannot do song to ringtone convertion, (you can with many european phones), etc. etc. Either ATT has Apple by the balls, or Apple just doesn't care at all for the user, and tries to screw them as much as they can.

Author: nickb
Title: Prof. Randy Pausch's last lecture: Really Achieving Your Childhood Dreams (video, full talk)

Author: mattmaroon
Content: In poker we have a saying about tournaments, which is that they are a lottery and the best players get a few extra tickets. The business world seems much the same. Luckily just like in poker, if you keep getting a disproportionately large number of tickets, and keep drawing over and over, your chances of winning approach 1.\n

Author: alex_c
Title: The Pmarca Guide to Career Planning, Part 1

Author: rms
Content:
With Windows, you can turn font smoothing off completely and the fonts look like pixel fonts. With Linux and Mac, things look terrible without font smoothing.

See this post for an explanation of the fundamental difference between Mac and Windows font smoothing: Mac tries to render as closely to the printed typeface as possible and Windows tries to look good onscreen.\nhttp://www.codinghorror.com/blog/archives/000885.html

Author: mattmaroon
Content: I'm definitely not a fan of Mac fonts, but that might just be what I'm used to.

Author: skmurphy
Content: One thing not mentioned is to send it to yourself. That seems to trigger most of the emotional/regret glands associated with the send button, it stores the content of the message verbatim, and you can review it in the morning and really send it if you feel the same way. I also have Eudora configured so that it only sends mail once and hour so that even though I have hit the send button I typically have some time to experience the "l'esprit d'escalier" or "I wish I had said this instead" triggered by the send button. \n

Content:

Author: mattmaroon
Content: I always want to try OSX, but the ridiculous price and sub par hardware/build quality keep turning me away. All of my friends have Macbook Pros, had it not been for that I probably would have gotten one by now.
